title: SXSW Sydney Cancels 2026 Edition
description:
SXSW Sydney has canceled its 2026 edition and announced that the event will â€œconclude its runâ€ in the Australian city. 

	A statement shared by TEG
body:
SXSW Sydney has canceled its 2026 edition and announced that the event will â€œconclude its runâ€ in the Australian city. 

	A statement shared by TEG said that the decision â€œreflects a changing global environment that is impacting major events, festivals and cultural programs worldwideâ€.

	â€œSXSW Sydney worked closely with the NSW Government and SXSWâ€™s global owners, Penske Media Corporation to explore potential pathways forward for the event, however, prevailing market conditions mean the Sydney edition will not be going ahead at this time,â€ the statement added. 
	

	â€œBetween 2023 and 2025, SXSW Sydney generated an estimated $276 million in total economic impact. The event attracted more than 63,000 out-of-region attendees and recorded a 35% year-on-year growth in international visitation between 2024 and 2025. In 2025 alone, the event attracted a total attendance of more than 345,000, representing a 15% year-on-year increase.â€


	Simon Cahill and Jono Whyman, SXSW Sydney co-managing directors, said in a joint statement: â€œSXSW Sydney would not have been possible without our partners, Destination NSW and SXSW, as well as those who contributed to the event â€“ our speakers, sponsors, volunteers and attendees. SXSW Sydney was an unforgettable three-year journey, and we owe a debt of gratitude to the people who joined us for it.

	Cahill and Whyman added, â€œWe are especially grateful to the SXSW Sydney team for their dedication and hard work in bringing this event to life and establishing a platform that showcased Australia and the Asia-Pacific as pioneers in global culture.â€
	

	Over its three-year run, SXSW Sydney attracted an array of high-profile talent, including Chance the Rapper, Nicole Kidman, Teddy Swims, The Kid LAROI and Paul Feig.

title: New â€˜Avatar: The Last Airbenderâ€™ Comic Series â€˜Kyoshi Warriorsâ€™ Set From Original Creators, Dark Horse (EXCLUSIVE)
description: A new comic book series based in the â€œAvatar: The Last Airbenderâ€ universe will launch this spring from Dark Horse Comics and the creators of the or
body:
A new comic book series based in the â€œAvatar: The Last Airbenderâ€ universe will launch this spring from Dark Horse Comics and the creators of the original Nickelodeon animated series. 

	Titled â€œAvatar: The Last Airbender â€” Kyoshi Warriors,â€ the story, developed in collaboration with Avatar Studios and â€œAvatar: The Last Airbenderâ€ co-creators Michael Dante DiMartino and Bryan Konietzko,  will be told over three monthly installments. 
	

	Per the official description for â€œAvatar: The Last Airbender â€” Kyoshi Warriors,â€: â€œSuki and the Kyoshi Warriors leave their island home to join the war against the Fire Nation. Met with suspicion and resentment by the mainlanders, they struggle to prove their worth to the Earth Kingdom. But when that opportunity arises, will they be willing to compromise their values as Kyoshi Warriors to embrace it?â€


	The three-issue series is written by Brandon HoÃ¡ng (â€œThe Crossbow of Destinyâ€), illustrated by BellBessa (â€œAvatar: The Last Airbender â€” Ramen Rumbleâ€) and Xanthe Bouma, colored by Adele Matera (â€œAvatar: The Last Airbender â€” Ashes of the Academy), and lettered by Comicraftâ€™s Jimmy Betancourt (Ghostbusters: Dead Manâ€™s Chest).

	See below for a first-look at the feature cover art for the first issue of â€œKyoshi Warriors,â€ drawn by Danielle Weires, who illustrates all three covers for the series.

	The first of three issues of â€œAvatar: The Last Airbender: The Kyoshi Warriorsâ€ will hit comic book stores May 6 and is now available for preorder. Each 22-page issue is priced at $4.99.

	Dark Horse has already partnered with the â€œAvatar: The Last Airbenderâ€ franchise for multiple comic books and graphic novels with this new collection announced ahead of the premiere of Netflixâ€™s live-action TV series adaptation of the show.

schema.headline: New â€˜Avatar: The Last Airbenderâ€™ Comic Series â€˜Kyoshi Warriorsâ€™ Set From Original Creators, Dark Horse (EXCLUSIVE)

title: â€˜Euphoriaâ€™ Season 3 Trailer: Zendaya, Sydney Sweeney and Jacob Elordi Return as Rue Battles Drug Dealers, Cassie Becomes a Cam Girl and More
description:
The first trailer for â€œEuphoriaâ€ Season 3 has finally arrived ahead of its April 12 premiere on HBO and HBO Max.

	Main cast members Zendaya, Sydney
body:
The first trailer for â€œEuphoriaâ€ Season 3 has finally arrived ahead of its April 12 premiere on HBO and HBO Max.

	Main cast members Zendaya, Sydney Sweeney, Hunter Schafer, Jacob Elordi, Eric Dane, Alexa Demie, Maude Apatow, Martha Kelly, Chloe Cherry, Colman Domingo and Dominic Fike are all returning for Season 3. Past cast members Barbie Ferreira, Storm Reid, Javon â€œWannaâ€ Walton and Austin Abrams will not be back for the new season. Angus Cloud, who broke out in his role as Fezco,Â died at age 25Â in July 2023.
	

	Season 2 ended with Lexiâ€™s (Apatow) play that was inspired by the lives of her so-called friends and classmates, Nate (Elordi) getting his dad Cal (Dane) arrested after finding a flashdrive with his illegal sexual encounters and Jules (Schafter) and Rue (Zendaya) seemingly rekindling their romance as Rue stays sober. Season 3 takes place years later and follow the characters after they are out of high school.


	The new season jumps ahead five years, which sees Cassie and Nate married and living in the suburbs and Rue living in Mexico and working off her debt to drug dealer Laurie. Levinson previously revealed that Jules is in art school and Maddy is working at a talent agency in Hollywood.

	Newcomers to the season include Sharon Stone, RosalÃ­a, Trisha Paytas, Natasha Lyonne, Danielle Deadwyler, Eli Roth and Marshawn Lynch. Plus: Adewale Akinnuoye-Agbaje, Toby Wallace, Darrell Britt-Gibson, Kadeem Hardison, Priscilla Delgado, James Landry HÃ©bert, Anna Van Patten, Asante Blackk, Bella Podaras, Bill Bodner, Cailyn Rice, Colleen Camp, Gideon Adlon, Hemky Madera, Homer Gere, Jack Topalian, Jessica Blair Herman, Kwame Patterson, Madison Thompson, Matthew Willig, Rebecca Pidgeon and Sam Trammell.
	

	Watch the trailer below.

schema.headline: â€˜Euphoriaâ€™ Season 3 Trailer: Zendaya, Sydney Sweeney and Jacob Elordi Return as Rue Battles Drug Dealers, Cassie Becomes a Cam Girl and More

title: â€˜Poltergeistâ€™ Child Star Heather Oâ€™Rourke Doc â€˜She Was Hereâ€™ Sets February Release, Unveils Trailer (EXCLUSIVE)
description: Virgil Films and IndieCan Entertainment have acquired North American rights to â€œShe Was Here,â€ a feature documentary examining the life of Heather O
body:
Virgil Films and IndieCan Entertainment have acquired North American rights to â€œShe Was Here,â€ a feature documentary examining the life of Heather Oâ€™Rourke, the child actor who starred in the â€œPoltergeistâ€ trilogy before her death at age 12.

	The film will launch on VOD and digital platforms Feb. 24, with Kino Lorber handling DVD distribution the same day. The documentary arrives in what would have been Oâ€™Rourkeâ€™s 50th year.


	Directed by Brian Pocrass and Nick Bailey, the project was developed with complete participation from Oâ€™Rourkeâ€™s family members, who appear throughout the film. Producers are Reese Eveneshen and Avi Federgreen.
	

	Oâ€™Rourke gained fame at age five after Steven Spielberg cast her in â€œPoltergeist,â€ where she delivered the memorable line â€œTheyâ€™re hereâ€¦â€ Her tragic passing has been the subject of longstanding rumors about a â€œPoltergeist curse.â€

	The documentary aims to counter decades of internet speculation and conspiracy theories surrounding Oâ€™Rourkeâ€™s death by presenting an authorized account from those who knew her. The filmmakers secured access to the familyâ€™s private collection of diaries, letters, photographs and previously unseen home videos.

	The film includes interviews with Oâ€™Rourkeâ€™s sisters Kathleen and Tammy Oâ€™Rourke, along with industry figures including Craig T. Nelson, JoBeth Williams, Zach Galligan, Gary Sherman and Chris Alexander. Several participants are speaking publicly about Oâ€™Rourke for the first time.

	A trailer and poster for the documentary are being released to coincide with the anniversary milestone. Virgil Films will distribute in the U.S., with IndieCan Entertainment handling Canadian territories.
	

	Watch the trailer here:

schema.headline: â€˜Poltergeistâ€™ Child Star Heather Oâ€™Rourke Doc â€˜She Was Hereâ€™ Sets February Release, Unveils Trailer (EXCLUSIVE)

title: â€˜Game of Thronesâ€™ Mobile Game â€˜Legendsâ€™ Sets â€˜A Knight of the Seven Kingdomsâ€™ Tie-In Ahead of HBO Spinoffâ€™s Premiere (EXCLUSIVE)
description: HBOâ€™s new â€œGame of Thronesâ€ spinoff series â€œA Knight of the Seven Kingdomsâ€ has launched a tie-in with Zynga mobile game â€œGame of Thrones: Legendsâ€
body:
HBOâ€™s new â€œGame of Thronesâ€ spinoff series â€œA Knight of the Seven Kingdomsâ€ has launched a tie-in with Zynga mobile game â€œGame of Thrones: Legendsâ€ featuring leading characters Ser Duncan the Tall and Egg.

	The new additions to the Zynga game, licensed by Warner Bros. Interactive on behalf of HBO, come amid the Sunday premiere of â€œA Knight of the Seven Kingdoms,â€ the latest â€œGame of Thronesâ€ TV spinoff. 


	The RPG puzzle game will feature Duncan and Egg as two new â€œchampionâ€ options in the game, which already boasts a lineup including â€œGoTâ€ fan-favorites like Jon Snow and Daenerys Targaryen and Rhaenyra Targaryen. 
	

	In the game, players build and lead their own Westeros house, honing their tactics and skills as they strategically assemble a team of champions, equip weapons and gear, and face formidable foes from the â€œGame of Thronesâ€ universe in puzzle battles.

	Ser Duncan will be available beginning Wednesday, while Egg will join the game Feb. 11 as â€œas a healer, best paired with his protector, Ser Duncan, for bonus healing and shield capabilities.â€

	Per Zynga, â€œSer Duncan the Tall joins as a Legendary Protector, who can be a key anchor for a playerâ€™s battle team. His skill allows him to retaliate against enemy attacks when the teamâ€™s weakest member is struck, and his passive ability can block incoming attacks from reaching their intended victims. He buys time for his allies, soaking up damage, to allow his allies to stack damage over time or to build effects like fire.â€

	On Feb. 4, â€œLegendsâ€ will launch a jousting mini-game as part of the â€œTourney of Ashford Meadowâ€ in-game event inspired by â€œA Knight of the Seven Kingdoms.â€
	

	â€œIn the upcoming Tourney at Ashford Meadow event, players will face off against rival knights in a joust. They will choose one of three virtues to leverage against their opponentâ€“Speed, Power, or Aimâ€“and compete against the rival knightâ€™s own chosen virtue,â€ Zyngaâ€™s description reads. â€œOnce the joust begins, the player will either win and proceed to another joust and greater rewards or lose everything theyâ€™ve won thus far. The fast-paced experience presents players with a series of high-risk, high-reward decisions, forcing them to choose between continuing to pursue greater glory or walking away with their winnings.â€

	â€œAs the â€˜Game of Thronesâ€™ universe continues to expand, so does the world we are building within â€˜Game of Thrones: Legendsâ€™ by bringing new characters, storylines, and gameplay features to our loyal house of players,â€ Zynga mobile games executive producer Yaron Leyvand said. â€œIncorporating â€˜A Knight of the Seven Kingdomsâ€™ brings the number of in-game champions to over 150, allowing players to strategically build their ideal house to battle other dedicated fans in real-time, and to experience an authentic personalized story based on â€˜Game of Thronesâ€™ lore.â€

	Zyngaâ€™s mobile game â€œGame of Thrones: Slotsâ€ will also launch a tie-in for â€œA Knight of the Seven Kingdoms.â€ Dubbed â€œTourney at Dusk,â€ the month-long takeover event will run throughout January, allowing players â€œthe opportunity to engage with new themed content, rewards, and special quests focused on Ser Duncun as he begins his adventure within the Game of Thrones universe.â€

	See the reveal video for the â€œA Knight of the Seven Kingdomsâ€ tie-in with â€œGame of Thrones: Legendsâ€ below.

schema.headline: â€˜Game of Thronesâ€™ Mobile Game â€˜Legendsâ€™ Sets â€˜A Knight of the Seven Kingdomsâ€™ Tie-In Ahead of HBO Spinoffâ€™s Premiere (EXCLUSIVE)

title: Andreea Gleeson Stepping Down as TuneCore CEO
description: Andreea Gleeson, CEO of the digital music distributor TuneCore, will be stepping down from her post, she announced Wednesday in an internal memo obt
body:
Andreea Gleeson, CEO of the digital music distributor TuneCore, will be stepping down from her post, she announced Wednesday in an internal memo obtained by Variety. 

	The companyâ€™s leadership will be overseen by Romain Vivien, the France-based parent company Believeâ€™s global head of music, with senior executives including chief revenue officer Brian Miller and chief technology and product officer Luxi Huang. A rep for the company tells Variety that Gleesonâ€™s role will not be filled, although she will continue indefinitely as a strategic advisor for Believe.
	

	While TuneCore announced last year that independent artists have earned more than $5 billion through the company, in November 2024 it was hit with a $500 million copyright-infringement lawsuit from multiple labels, including Universal Music Group, Concord Music Group and ABKCO Music that claims Believe and TuneCore knowingly distributed infringing copies of sound recordings from artists including Ariana Grande, Justin Bieber, Billie Eilish, Kendrick Lamar and others; the rep had no comment on the status of the lawsuit.


	In 2023, TuneCore and Believe united with CD Baby and its parent company Downtown, DistroKid, UnitedMasters, Symphonic, Empire, and Vydia, along with digital service providers Spotify and Amazon Music, to create Music Fights Fraud, which was described as an industry-wide anti-fraud initiative. 

	That same year, the company commissioned a study on gender-based inequalities in music called â€œBe the Change.â€ 

	Gleeson joined the company as chief marketing officer in 2015 after stints at the retail giants Lord & Taylor and Hudsonâ€™s Bay, and was promoted to co-head and chief revenue officer in 2020, rising to CEO the following year. She was among the honorees at Varietyâ€˜s 2022 Power of Women: New York celebration. 
	

	Gleesonâ€™s note, and one from Believe founder-CEO Denis Ladegaillerie, follow in full.

	As I write this, Iâ€™m filled with pride, gratitude, and a deep sense of connection to all of you.

	After ten years at TuneCore, and with the company well-positioned for continued success, Believe and I have mutually agreed that the time is right for me to transition. Effective immediately, Iâ€™ll be moving from my role as CEO of TuneCore into a Strategic Advisor position for Believe.

	As TuneCore enters this next phase from a position of strength, its mission remains: empower independent artists to succeed on their own terms, moving them from â€œaccess to successâ€ through an efficient, automated platform. Moving forward, TuneCore will prioritize harnessing more fully the capabilities of Believe, to help artists grow globally.Â 

	Believe and I looked at what the future requires and agreed the best path is for me to support Believeâ€™s executive team in an advisory capacity to continue building where I can have the greatest impact.

	Leading TuneCore has been one of the most meaningful chapters of my career. Together, weâ€™ve transformed this company, expanding our global footprint, strengthening and modernizing the platform, and pivoting from just distribution to artist development by launching programs like TuneCore Accelerator to give artists deeper support, education, and access to real career-building opportunities. Through it all, we stayed true to what matters most: an artist-first mission and a belief in independence.

	None of this happened because of one person. It happened because of all of you. Your creativity, resilience, ambition, and care for artists shaped TuneCore into what it is today. Iâ€™ve been continually inspired by the way this team shows up for each other and for the creators who trust us with their careers.

	TuneCoreâ€™s success has also been deeply connected to the Believe Groupâ€™s long-term vision and global scale, which allowed us to grow with purpose while serving independent artists at every stage of their journey. This planned transition reflects my confidence in the strength of this team and in TuneCoreâ€™s next phase of growth within the Believe ecosystem.

	While my role is changing, my belief in this company and in all of you is unwavering. Thank you for the trust, the hard work, the laughter, the late nights, and the shared wins. TuneCore will always be a part of who I am and I canâ€™t wait to see what you build next.
	

	With gratitude, Andreea

	Denis Ladegaillerie, Founder and CEO, Believe statement:

	We are grateful to Andreea for her leadership of TuneCore and the lasting impact she has had on the business. Over the course of her tenure, TuneCore strengthened its platform, expanded its global reach, and deepened its commitment to artist success. Her work co-founding the Music Fights Fraud Alliance and advancing gender equity in the music industry reflects values that are at the heart of Believe and areas we will continue to prioritize.

	As part of an evolution aligned with TuneCoreâ€™s next phase of growth and Believeâ€™s long-term strategy, Andreea will transition into a Strategic Advisor role for Believe, where her experience and perspective will continue to support the Group at a strategic level.

	TuneCore leadership will continue to be overseen by Romain Vivien, Believeâ€™s Global Head of Music, with senior executives including Chief Revenue Officer Brian Miller and Chief Technology and Product Officer Luxi Huang, to build on TuneCoreâ€™s strong momentum as we continue to invest in its future.â€

schema.headline: Andreea Gleeson Stepping Down as TuneCore CEO

title: Playboi Carti, YoungBoy, Don Toliver to Headline Rolling Loud Festivalâ€™s Only 2026 U.S. Date
description: Playboi Carti, YoungBoy Never Broke Again and Don Toliver will headline Rolling Loud, which has become arguably the worldâ€™s biggest hip-hop festival
body:
Playboi Carti, YoungBoy Never Broke Again and Don Toliver will headline Rolling Loud, which has become arguably the worldâ€™s biggest hip-hop festival. While it traditionally has as many as three U.S. dates per year, in 2026 will make just one stop in the country: a three-day festival May 8â€“10, 2026 at Camping World Stadium in Orlando, Fla. Tickets are available now.

	Additional performers include EsDeeKid, Chief Keef, Sexyy Red, Fakemink, Destroy Lonely, BossMan Dlow, OsamaSon, Nettspend, PlaqueBoyMax, and 70-odd others.
	



	

	



	â€œRolling Loud 2026 represents a new chapter for us,â€ says Rolling Loud co-founder Matt Zingler. â€œOrlando felt like the right place to evolve the festival. Itâ€™s a new city, a new venue, and a lineup that truly reflects where hip-hop is today. From the headliners to the rising artists, this year is about celebrating the full spectrum of the culture while delivering an unmatched experience for fans at a price that keeps Rolling Loud accessible.â€

	â€œThis lineup is a statement,â€ says Rolling Loud co-founder Tariq Cherif. â€œPlayboi Carti, YoungBoy Never Broke Again, and Don Toliver each represent different forces shaping hip-hop right now, and bringing them together for our only U.S. festival of 2026 felt intentional. Eleven years in, Rolling Loud is still about putting the culture first and creating moments, elevating new voices, and building something that fans can feel proud to be part of.â€

	GA passes start at $279 and VIP passes at $599.

	The Rolling Loud World Tour is making its next stops in Sydney and Melbourne, Australia on March 7-8, 2026 with headliners Gunna and Ken Carson, plus Sexyy Red, Swae Lee, Tyga, Ski Mask The Slump God, Ian, Osamason and more. In November 2025, the debut Rolling Loud India brought 65,000 fans together for sets from headliners Central Cee, Wiz Khalifa, Don Toliver and Karan Aujla.

schema.headline: Playboi Carti, YoungBoy, Don Toliver to Headline Rolling Loud Festivalâ€™s Only 2026 U.S. Date

title: Will â€™28 Years Later: Bone Templeâ€™ Dethrone â€˜Avatar: Fire and Ashâ€™ at the Box Office?
description: Can â€œ28 Years Later: The Bone Templeâ€ claw to the top of the domestic box office, or will James Cameronâ€™s â€œAvatar: Fire and Ashâ€ rule for the fifth
body:
Can â€œ28 Years Later: The Bone Templeâ€ claw to the top of the domestic box office, or will James Cameronâ€™s â€œAvatar: Fire and Ashâ€ rule for the fifth consecutive weekend?

	â€œThe Bone Temple,â€ the fourth installment in Sonyâ€™s dystopian â€œ28 Days Laterâ€ franchise, is aiming for $20 million to $22 million in its four-day domestic debut over the Martin Luther King Jr. holiday. The film arrives about six months after its predecessor, â€œ28 Years Later,â€ which opened last June to $30 million over the traditional three-day weekend. â€œ28 Years Laterâ€ ended its run with a tidy $70 million in North America and $150 million globally against a $60 million budget. This zombie sequel carries a slightly higher $63 million price tag. 
	

	Directed by Nia DaCosta and written by series creator Alex Garland, â€œThe Bone Templeâ€ takes place after the previous film and brings back Ralph Fiennes, Jack Oâ€™Connell and Alfie Williams as they continue to grapple with a Rage Virus thatâ€™s ravaging a post-apocalyptic Britain. The film could benefit from a dearth of competition as well as positive reviews. â€œ28 Years Later: The Bone Templeâ€ currently holds a 94% Rotten Tomatoes average, with Varietyâ€™s chief film critic Peter Debruge writing that â€œitâ€™s bold, mind-bending work which satisfies that so-often-frustrated craving for a zombie movie with brains.â€


	Elsewhere, Chloe Zhaoâ€™s Shakespearean tragedy â€œHamnetâ€ is expanding to 688 theaters after several weekends in limited release. The film, which just won the Golden Globe for best motion picture drama as well as a best actress trophy for star Jessie Buckley, has earned an impressive $13 million domestically during its platform rollout. 
	

	Meanwhile the reigning box office champ â€œAvatar: Fire and Ashâ€ is looking to add $12 million to $14 million over the four-day frame. Although a theatrical juggernaut with $1.23 billion globally, the third â€œAvatarâ€ is running out of steam faster than its predecessors. To wit, the first two films were No. 1 at the box office for seven consecutive weekends, while the domination of â€œFire and Ashâ€ might end after five. Of course, Hollywoodâ€™s expectations for â€œAvatar 3â€ are stratospheric because the prior films, 2009â€™s â€œAvatarâ€ and 2022â€™s â€œAvatar: The Way of Water,â€ stand as two of the biggest movies in history with $2.9 billion and $2.3 billion, respectively. (The director has joked that after assessing the financial results of the third installment, heâ€™ll hold a press conferenceÂ to determine whether heâ€™ll proceed with â€œAvatar 4â€ and â€œAvatar 5.â€) 

	January tends to be slower for movie theaters, at least compared to the summer months and holiday season. Hollywood has set a few potential hits in the first month of the year, however, including Amazon MGMâ€™s sci-fi adventure â€œMercyâ€ with Chris Pratt, Sam Raimiâ€™s survival horror film â€œSend Helpâ€ and the Jason Statham-led â€œShelter.â€

	â€œPatience we will be a virtue as we await some of the bigger openers on the way,â€ notes Comscoreâ€™s head of marketplace trends Paul Dergarabedian.

schema.headline: Will â€™28 Years Later: Bone Templeâ€™ Dethrone â€˜Avatar: Fire and Ashâ€™ at the Box Office?

title: iHeartMedia Unveils Nominees for 2026 iHeartPodcast Awards at SXSW, Hosted by Ego Nwodim
description: Listen up: iHeartMedia announced nominations for the 2026 iHeartPodcast Awards in partnership with South by Southwest, to be hosted by comedian and
body:
Listen up: iHeartMedia announced nominations for the 2026 iHeartPodcast Awards in partnership with South by Southwest, to be hosted by comedian and podcaster Ego Nwodim.

	For the second straight year, the iHeartPodcast Awards will be presented at ACL Live at the Moody Theater in Austin, Texas, at SXSW on Monday, March 16, starting at 7 p.m. CT. The event also will be livestreamed on select iHeartMedia radio stations and on the iHeartRadio app.
	

	The annual awards show will honor the most influential podcasters of the year across 28 categories, including the eveningâ€™s top honor, the fan-voted Podcast of the Year award. (See the full list of nominees below.)


	Nominees for Podcast of the Year are: â€œGood Hang With Amy Poehlerâ€ â€” which just won the first-ever Golden Globe for best podcast â€” â€œThe Breakfast Club,â€ â€œThe Mel Robbins Podcast,â€ â€œPablo Torre Finds Out,â€ the New York Timesâ€™ â€œThe Daily,â€ â€œThe Rest Is History,â€ â€œThis Past Weekend w/ Theo Von,â€ â€œCall Her Daddy,â€ â€œHeavyweightâ€ and â€œGiggly Squad.â€ From Jan. 14-Feb. 22, listeners can cast their vote for their Podcast of the Year at iheartpodcastawards.com. Winners in the other categories will be selected by a panel of â€œindustry leaders, creatives and visionaries,â€ according to iHeartMedia.

	â€œSaturday Night Liveâ€ alum Nwodim will emcee this yearâ€™s iHeartPodcast Awards. Sheâ€™s the host of the â€œThanks Dadâ€ podcast, which is nominated in the best emerging podcast category. Nwodimâ€™s podcast is produced with and distributed by iHeartMediaÂ and Will Ferrellâ€™s Big Money Players Network.
	

	In addition to the iHeartPodcast Awards fan-voted and category awards, iHeartMedia will present three Icon Awards honoring â€œindividuals who have made groundbreaking contributions to the podcasting medium.â€ Jay Shetty, author and host of popular podcast â€œOn Purpose,â€ will receive the 2026 Social Impact Award; Terry Gross, legendary host of NPRâ€™s â€œFresh Air,â€ will receive the 2026 Audible Audio Pioneer Award for a career that has â€œredefined the art of the interview through curiosity, rigor and deep empathyâ€; and Hrishikesh Hirway, creator of â€œSong Exploder,â€ will be presented with the 2026 Innovator Award for â€œhis visionary approach to storytelling, inviting artists to break down their creative processes and redefining how audiences experience music in podcast form,â€ iHeartMedia said.

	At last yearâ€™s iHeartPodcast Awards, the Podcast of the Year Award went to â€œLas Culturistas,â€ hosted by Bowen Yang and Matt Rogers, which is nominated this year the pop culture category.

	â€œPodcasting continues to be one of the most vibrant and fast-growing mediums in media today,â€ said Will Pearson, president of iHeartPodcasts, in a statement. â€œWe are thrilled to return to Austin and ACL Live at the Moody Theater to celebrate the storytellers who are pushing the boundaries of audio.â€

	Peter Lewis, chief commercial officer of SXSW, added: â€œThe Podcast Awards have become a defining moment for the audio community at SXSW, and weâ€™re proud to continue building that momentum with iHeartMedia in 2026. Bringing this event back to ACL Live at the Moody Theater reflects how deeply podcasting is embedded in the cultural conversation at SXSW, and our commitment to creating meaningful stages for the creators shaping where audio goes next.â€

	Amazonâ€™s Audible is a sponsor of the 2026 iHeartPodcast Awards. Executive producers for the event are John Sykes, Tom Poleman, Conal Byrne and Bart Peters for iHeartMedia. More details including guest presenters and celebrity appearances will be announced in the coming months.

title: â€˜La Chimeraâ€™ Director Alice Rohrwacher on Her EFA Honor and Making a Silent Film as Next Project: â€˜Itâ€™s a Completely Different Medium of Expressionâ€™
description: Italian director Alice Rohrwacher, known for highly original works â€œThe Wonders,â€ â€œHappy as Lazzaroâ€ and â€œLa Chimeraâ€ â€” all of which competed at Can
body:
Italian director Alice Rohrwacher, known for highly original works â€œThe Wonders,â€ â€œHappy as Lazzaroâ€ and â€œLa Chimeraâ€ â€” all of which competed at Cannes Film Festival â€” is taking her exploration of cinematic language to a bold new level by shooting a silent movie.

	Rohrwacher, 44, who will be honored on Saturday in Berlin at the European Film Awards with the European Achievement in World Cinema prize, revealed this distinctive aspect of her next project to Variety during a wide-ranging interview. Reflecting on her illustrious career thus far, Rohrwacher says she has been â€œtrying to understand why, in this world that is so battered with images, itâ€™s still so necessary to rely on an image in order to deconstruct the images that surround us.â€
	

	Rohrwacherâ€™s silent movie, which she is currently prepping â€” but is staying mum about in terms of details â€” will be â€œa great opportunity to really delve deeply into imagesâ€ and â€œto find their power through subtraction,â€ she says. Below, Rohrwacher speaks more about receiving an EFA honor, the importance of her collaborators and whatâ€™s next.

	
		How does it feel to get such an important honor after making just four features? 	

	Well, even though there are only four feature films, itâ€™s been a long journey of discovery. Partly because between one film and the next, there have been shorts and various types of documentaries. But also because our approach is so curated, Iâ€™d say so deep, that it actually feels like I havenâ€™t stopped for a moment. When they called and told me they were awarding me this prize, at first I thought there was a mistake. In the sense that, yes, itâ€™s been a long journey. But that thereâ€™s still a very, very long journey to come. And this journey really has to do with trying to understand why in this world that is so battered with images, itâ€™s still so necessary to rely on an image in order to deconstruct the images that surround us. But I thought, Iâ€™m lucky that they are giving me this award now, because this way I can be free to make even crazier and more wrong-headed films. Iâ€™ve already received this important and prestigious award. So now, even more so, it seems to me like a call to dare even more, to search even further.
	
	
		In its motivation for the prize the EFA writes, â€œWith a careful eye for the realities of a teenagerâ€™s life and a big heart for the countryside, she creates a unique universe for each of her films.â€ Do these words reflect your vision?	

	Itâ€™s a beautiful and moving motivation. The gaze of those who look at us always reveal things to us that perhaps we canâ€™t yet understand from within. I believe that for me the word â€œteenagerâ€ isnâ€™t really about a specific age, meaning itâ€™s not about adolescence per se, but about an inner adolescence. Because if I think about the protagonists of my films, theyâ€™re not just teenagers â€” except, perhaps, the first two. Maybe they are instead all teenagers in the sense that they potentially havenâ€™t yet figured out where they belong. This state of adolescence of the soul seems important to me. Because if I think about the world, as it is defined today, I canâ€™t see myself in it.

	And the countryside?

	The countryside, which is always a border land, a marginal place, is what attracts me most. Perhaps because itâ€™s precisely at the borders that things can change, where thereâ€™s still potential for development and imagination. In some ways, largely populated cities have become fossilized in an old form. A form that was necessary in another era. Outside the cities I find potential for change. I find a world that my characters can inhabit.
	
		Youâ€™ve made all your features working with the great cinematographer HÃ©lÃ¨ne Louvart. How is this collaboration an integral part of yourÂ work?	

	What unites us with HÃ©lÃ¨ne is, first and foremost, a spirit of adventure and exploration that begins before the film begins. What unites are questions about what weâ€™re doing and how to do it. I feel a great desire to work with her, precisely because weâ€™ve now established such a strong relationship thatâ€™s also a relationship of great freedom to dare and try. And perhaps make mistakes, and then discover something else. So, beyond just working with one of the greatest cinematographers whom I believe exist on the planet, itâ€™s about working with someone who has both the wisdom and the recklessness to find diversity each time she approaches a film as something new. And I like this, because both in the relationship with the crew and in the relationship with the film, thereâ€™s always a sense of novelty and exploration.
	

	All of your works are shot using different kinds of film stock but always on celluloid. Why?

	Itâ€™s not so much the [visual] result that makes us choose film. Because we know full well that the analog effect can now be achieved with digital. But itâ€™s a question of method. Film requires us to be much more careful and thoughtful about how to use it, because itâ€™s limited. And where weâ€™re faced with a limited resource, we develop creativity and imagination more. At least, thatâ€™s my feeling. Letâ€™s hope the laboratories survive, because cinema is certainly not just a result, but also a process and a method. And itâ€™s no coincidence that cinema was born with film.
	
		Tell me about working with Carlo Cresto-Dina and his Tempesta company, which has shepherded all your films to date.	

	[He] gave me the opportunity, and believed in what I could do before anyone else. He did this in a very instinctive way, without much basis to go on. Because when I made my first feature, Iâ€™d never made a short. Iâ€™d never worked with a crew. And so he was certainly very courageous, and that deserves recognition. I think this shows in the fact that this relationship has lasted so long, that somehow courage is something that unites us.
	
		Can you tell me what your next project is? 	

	I am working at more than one at the same time. My next project will be a silent movie, precisely in order to have this great opportunity to really delve deeply into images, to find their power through subtraction. Because of my great desire to use the image, the actor, and try to strip away everything thatâ€™s superfluous in the story and to see what we can still do [with that] today. I think that in any case silent cinema, and especially European silent cinema â€” the work of the great European masters â€” isnâ€™t merely something that came before talking cinema. Itâ€™s a completely different medium of expression. And so I hope to be able to experiment with it.

	This interviewÂ has been edited and condensed for clarity.

schema.headline: â€˜La Chimeraâ€™ Director Alice Rohrwacher on Her EFA Honor and Making a Silent Film as Next Project: â€˜Itâ€™s a Completely Different Medium of Expressionâ€™

title: Ford Worker Suspended After Yelling â€˜Pedophile Protectorâ€™ at Donald Trump on Video
description:
Michigan Ford Plant
                          Trump Heckler Taken Off Line
body:
Michigan Ford Plant
                          Trump Heckler Taken Off Line
                      
                  
                                                                        Published 
                              January 14, 2026
                            6:35 AM PST
                                                                      |
                                                                Updated 
                                  January 14, 2026
                                7:47 AM PST
                                    
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          The worker who yelled "pedophile protector" at President Donald Trump during his visit to a Ford plant in Michigan Tuesday has been suspended.
      
    
          The suspended worker has been identified as 40-year-old TJ Sabula, the United Auto Workers Union confirms to TMZ. Sabula admitted to The Washington Post to being the individual who shouted at the prez.
      
    
      
        
                    
                  
      
                    TMZ.com
          
    
          Sabula told the Washington Post ... "I donâ€™t feel as though fate looks upon you often, and when it does, you better be ready to seize the opportunity. And today I think I did that."
      
    
          It's unclear if his suspension is paid ... the union tells TMZ they are exploring next steps.
      

          Sabula feels no remorse about the scene he caused, telling WP ... "As far as calling him out, definitely no regrets whatsoever." However, he is concerned about his job and future employment, telling the Post he feels he was "targeted for political retribution" for "embarrassing Trump in front of his friends."
      
    
                    
                          
                                  
      
        
    
          He told the Washington Post he was yelling specifically about the Epstein Files.
      
    
          We showed you the video -- a man yelled out at Trump as he was walking through the factory ... and it clearly got under his skin. In response, the 47th President of the United States mouthed "F*** you" to the man before flipping him off.
      
    
          Just like Sabula has no regrets about the ideal, Trump didn't either. White House Communications Director Steven Cheung justified his reaction, telling TMZ ... "A lunatic was wildly screaming expletives in a complete fit of rage, and the President gave an appropriate and unambiguous response."
      
    
          There is now not one but 2 GoFundMe pages created for Sabula, with one just passing the $200,000 mark and the other sitting just above $50,000.

title: President Trump Filmed Flipping Off Ford Worker Who Yells 'Pedophile Protector' at Him
description:
President Trump
                          Hey, F*** You, Bub, For That Pedo Diss!!!
body:
President Trump
                          Hey, F*** You, Bub, For That Pedo Diss!!!
                      
                  
                                                                        Published 
                              
                January 13, 2026
                
                            12:58 PM PST
                                                                      |
                                                                Updated 
                                  January 14, 2026
                                7:49 AM PST
                                    
      
    
      
        
                    
                  
      
                    TMZ.com
          
    
          UPDATE
  
    
          2:45 PM PT -- White House Communications Director Steven Cheung tells TMZ ... "A lunatic was wildly screaming expletives in a complete fit of rage, and the President gave an appropriate and unambiguous response."
      
    
          Donald Trump turned into Donald Grump during a Tuesday appearance at a Ford plant ... launching into an F-bomb attack on a worker who appeared to yell "pedophile protector" at the Prez.
      
    
          47 toured the Ford F-150 plant at the Detroit Economic Club before giving a speech ... while walking the factory floor on his tour, someone began shouting at Trump. It's hard to make out the full sentence shouted at Trump, but it seems to have included the words "pedophile protector."
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          The angry worker is obviously referencing Trump's association with late convicted pedophile Jeffrey Epstein ... and the Dept. of Justice's slow release of the infamous Epstein Files.
      

          In true presidential fashion, Trump responds by yelling down at the guy ... pretty clearly saying "F*** you" before flipping him the bald eagle.
      
    
          As you know ... the Trump administration's snail-like pace in releasing the notorious Epstein files has convinced some online that the prez is forcing the Department of Justice to hide incriminating info from the public.
      
    
          President Trump has denied all wrongdoing ... sticking by his story that he stopped talking to Epstein after the guy poached several of his massage therapists.
      
    
          Still, people haven't stopped linking the two ... and, it's looks like the president's flipping out -- over the innuendo.
      
    
          A spokesperson for Ford tells TMZ ... "We had a great event today and weâ€™re proud of how our employees represented Ford. Weâ€™ve seen the clip youâ€™re referring to. One of our core values is respect and we donâ€™t condone anyone saying anything inappropriate like that within our facilities. When that happens, we have a process to deal with it but we donâ€™t get into specific personnel matters."
      
      
              
          
                          
                Donald Trump
              
                          
                Jeffrey Epstein
              
                          
                President Trump
              
                          
                Politix
              
                          
                Exclusive
              
                          
                News

schema.headline: President Trump Filmed Flipping Off Ford Worker Who Yells 'Pedophile Protector' at Him
